byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib from Kabul; an employee of The New York Times from Baghlan Province, Afghanistan; and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: American airstrikes hit crowded hospital run by Doctors Without Borders in Kunduz, Afghanistan, killing at least 19 patients, staff members and others; American military says it was targeting militants nearby and acknowledges its role in deaths; incident renews criticism over failure of United States military to prevent civilian casualties.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. military said “there may have been collateral damage” to a medical facility in Kunduz. Doctors Without Borders said 19 were killed and dozens wounded.

headline.main: Airstrike Hits Doctors Without Borders Hospital in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Blamed After Bombs Hit Afghan Hospital

snippet: The U.S. military said “there may have been collateral damage” to a medical facility in Kunduz. Doctors Without Borders said 19 were killed and dozens wounded.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
